intro: Hieracium atratum subsp. sukaczewii, commonly known as the dark hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to parts of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It has a creeping rootstock and produces numerous flowering stems that bear small, clustered flowers. The subspecies sukaczewii is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to other subspecies of Hieracium atratum.
